title-group.article-title: International Study of Health Care Organization and Financing for End-Stage Renal Disease in France

abstract.p: The major features of ESRD management in France include the predominance of hemodialysis and the resulting competition for dialysis stations. In 2003, the prevalence of ESRD in France was 0.087%. Of the 52,000 ESRD patients, 30,882 were receiving dialysis and 21,233 had functioning renal transplants. The annual expenditure per ESRD patient in 2003 was estimated at ⋹40,975. Autodialysis, at ⋹49,133 per patient per year, was much less expensive than dialyzing in-center at either a public or private facility (⋹111,006 and ⋹75,125, respectively). Transplant activity in France has rapidly increased in recent years, reaching 22 donors per million population in 2005.
